Description: Terracotta statuette of boy wearing a hat, following Tanagra types. Mould-made and hollow. White coating, with traces of pink paint. Fine Red-brown Nile silt fabric.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Two examples from Naukratis come from the same mould series (Harrow School, Old Speech Room Gallery & Museum HE959 U159l; Oxford, Ashmolean Museum AN1896-1908-E.4713). Parallels from Alexandria, mostly 3rd century BC (Tezgör 2007, nos,. 98-100, 126-30, 170, 177, 223). Tezgör, D. K. 2007. Tanagréennes d'Alexandrie : figurines de terre cuite hellénistiques des nécropoles orientales. Musée gréco-romain d'Alexandrie. Études alexandrines 13. Cairo : Institut Français d'Archéologie Orientale.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.428) (Phase 3)
